skill.name: sharing-skills
skill.description: Use when you've developed a broadly useful skill and want to contribute it upstream via pull request - guides process of branching, committing, pushing, and creating PR to contribute skills back to upstream repository
skill.summary: Use when you've developed a broadly useful skill and want to contribute it upstream via pull request...
skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing git workflow documentation. Executes standard git and gh CLI commands within the ~/.config/superpowers/skills/ directory. Behavior matches stated purpose of guiding skill contributions via pull requests.

content.value_statement: Contribute your useful skills back to the community. This skill guides you through branching, committing, pushing, and creating a pull request to share skills with upstream repositories.
actual_capabilities: Creates feature branches for skill contributions
Commits skill changes with proper format
Creates pull requests to upstream repositories
limitations: Requires gh CLI installed and authenticated
Cannot merge PRs - only creates them
Requires existing fork and upstream configuration

use_cases.title: Share useful skills
use_cases.description: Contribute tested skills to the upstream repository for community use

use_cases.title: Follow git workflow
use_cases.description: Properly branch, commit, and PR skills following contribution guidelines

use_cases.title: Collaborate on skills
use_cases.description: Push changes to fork and create reviewable PRs for skill improvements

prompt_templates.title: Share a new skill
prompt_templates.scenario: I want to contribute a new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use sharing-skills to help me contribute my [skill-name] skill to the upstream repository

prompt_templates.title: Update existing skill
prompt_templates.scenario: I need to update a skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use sharing-skills to help me update [existing-skill-name] and create a PR for the changes

prompt_templates.title: Sync before sharing
prompt_templates.prompt: Use sharing-skills to sync my fork with upstream and prepare a branch for [skill-name]

prompt_templates.title: After PR merge
prompt_templates.prompt: Use sharing-skills to help me clean up my local and remote branches after my PR was merged

output_examples.input: Use sharing-skills to help me share my new error-handling skill
output: Step 1: I'll check your current directory and help you sync with upstream
Step 2: Create a feature branch named 'add-error-handling-skill'
Step 3: Guide you through committing your skill with proper format
Step 4: Push your branch to your fork
Step 5: Create a pull request with description, testing notes, and context

best_practices: Test your skill thoroughly using writing-skills before sharing
Keep PRs focused - one skill per pull request
Include clear testing notes in your commit message
anti_patterns: Batching multiple skills into a single PR
Skipping the sync step before creating a branch

faq.question: What tools do I need installed?
faq.answer: You need gh CLI installed and authenticated with 'gh auth login'. Git is required as well.

faq.question: What directory should I be in?
faq.answer: Your working directory should be ~/.config/superpowers/skills/ where your local skills clone exists.

faq.question: How do I set up my fork?
faq.answer: Configure upstream remote pointing to the main repo and origin pointing to your fork on GitHub.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only executes git commands in your skills directory. No credentials are collected or transmitted beyond gh CLI.

faq.question: What if my PR has merge conflicts?
faq.answer: Fetch upstream and rebase on the latest main branch, then resolve conflicts and force push your branch.

faq.question: How is this different from writing-skills?
faq.answer: writing-skills helps you create and test skills. sharing-skills helps you contribute finished skills upstream via PR.
